intro: Macrolobium bijugum, commonly known as the twin-lobed macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
